item.title: Holy shit
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
don’t mind Ramirezoid he is just harmonically confused. We cant blame him for not being able to comprehend the unique melodies that are interwoven into a complex layering of a mental struggle of a robot trapped in his metal mind attempting to escape.

but long complicated sentences aside, to each his own.
But I am curious why you don’t enjoy them. [COLOR=‘DimGray’](I have only met a few people who haven’t and they tend to have vastly varying reasons)

item.title: Holy shit
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Not the suits, the CGI. The lightcycles were going to look like what they look like in legacy… The rider was suppsed to merge into the bike seamlessly. They couldn’t afford it, and they went with the cockpitted cycle. Because of LIMITATIONS.

The landscapes of tron were originally going to be foggy, and chrome… Limitations.

https://media.photobucket.com/image/tron%20concept%20art/spacemonkey_fg/tron13.jpg

Those are all pieces of concept art from the first movie. Legacy’s look comes from those, not the first movie.

Read full topic

item.title: Holy shit
item.dc:creator: Collision
item.description:
xalener:

They’re working off the concepts for the first movie that they weren’t able to build upon due to technichal limits.

This is basically what tron would’ve looked like had computers been a bit better.

Plus the world is more organic simply because Flynn has been in there for 20 years. That’s 20 years of NATURAL evolution in a computer server (so it’s EXTRA fucking fast) because Flynn was the catalyst.

And sure it doesn’t look EXACTLY the same, but anyone whose seen the film, then this trailer (without title or mention of names) would know it’s tron.

But your quote DOES bring up another point. HL2 doesn’t make you feel nostalgic about HL1, correct? Because it’s a sequel. It’s purpose is to be a continuation. Not a remake whose purpose is to bring the old to the new and the new to the old.

Tron Legacy is a sequel. There’s no need for nostalgia.

The Original Tron was made to look like that for a reason.

The blocky 8-bit style, symmetry, how the edges and line of things glow, it wasn’t limitations it was how they wanted it.

Want to know an interesting pact, the suits they all wore, with the glowing lines, they were blank during the filming, and the ‘effect’ was drawn onto them all, frame by frame, not because of limitation, but because of dedication.

Read full topic

item.title: Holy shit
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Collision:

How can it possibly nostalgic?

It doesn’t look/feel the same as the original Tron.

Its like saying playing HL2 gives you nostalgia for HL1.

They’re working off the concepts for the first movie that they weren’t able to build upon due to technichal limits.

This is basically what tron would’ve looked like had computers been a bit better.

Plus the world is more organic simply because Flynn has been in there for 20 years. That’s 20 years of NATURAL evolution in a computer server (so it’s EXTRA fucking fast) because Flynn was the catalyst.

And sure it doesn’t look EXACTLY the same, but anyone whose seen the film, then this trailer (without title or mention of names) would know it’s tron.

But your quote DOES bring up another point. HL2 doesn’t make you feel nostalgic about HL1, correct? Because it’s a sequel. It’s purpose is to be a continuation. Not a remake whose purpose is to bring the old to the new and the new to the old.

Tron Legacy is a sequel. There’s no need for nostalgia.

Read full topic
